data.name: M Venusaur-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crisis Vine
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.name: Venusaur-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Jungle Hammer
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.

data.name: Beedrill
data.flavorText: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Flash Needle
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. If all of them are heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

attacks.name: Leaf Munch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Grass Pokémon, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Ledyba
data.flavorText: When the weather turns cold, lots of Ledyba gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.

data.name: Volbeat
data.flavorText: It communicates with others by lighting up its rear at night. It loves Illumise's sweet aroma.

attacks.name: Luring Glow
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Signal Beam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Ledian
data.flavorText: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.

attacks.name: Mach Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pansage
data.flavorText: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Illumise
data.flavorText: Its fragrance attracts a swarm of Volbeat, so they draw over 200 patterns in the night sky.

attacks.name: Pheromotion
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Simisage
data.flavorText: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Chespin
data.flavorText: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Quilladin
data.flavorText: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators' attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Chesnaught
data.flavorText: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.

abilities.name: Spiky Shield
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Touchdown
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Scatterbug
data.flavorText: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.

data.name: Spewpa
data.flavorText: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Vivillon
data.flavorText: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.

attacks.name: Conversion Powder
attacks.text: Choose either Asleep or Poisoned. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Colorful Wind
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each different type of basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Gogoat
data.flavorText: It can tell how its trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathetic sense lets them run as if one being.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Supporter cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Charge Dash
attacks.text: You may do 20 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Skiddo
data.flavorText: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Slugma
data.flavorText: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Magcargo
data.flavorText: Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames that circulate throughout its body.

attacks.name: Magma Mantle
attacks.text: You may discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Fire Energy card, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Simisear
data.flavorText: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Fletchinder
data.flavorText: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Fennekin
data.flavorText: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Delphox
data.flavorText: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

abilities.name: Mystical Fire
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Blaze Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Braixen
data.flavorText: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.

attacks.name: Clairvoyant Eye
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

attacks.name: Fire Tail Slap
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Talonflame
data.flavorText: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.

attacks.name: Devastating Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 4 cards.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Blastoise-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Splash Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Shellder
data.flavorText: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

data.name: Cloyster
data.flavorText: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

attacks.name: Clamp Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: M Blastoise-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Bombard
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Starmie
data.flavorText: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon and heal all damage from it.

attacks.name: Core Splash
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Psychic Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.

attacks.name: Seafaring
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Corsola
data.flavorText: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure because of its beauty.

attacks.name: Refresh
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage and remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spiny Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Panpour
data.flavorText: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Simipour
data.flavorText: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

attacks.name: Recycle
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

data.name: Froakie
data.flavorText: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Frogadier
data.flavorText: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Greninja
data.flavorText: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

abilities.name: Water Shuriken
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Water Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mist Slash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

abilities.name: Destiny Burst
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, put 5 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.

attacks.name: Circle Circuit
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Electrode
data.flavorText: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."

attacks.name: Eerie Impulse
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Emolga-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Glide
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you attached Energy in this way, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Electron Crush
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Ekans
data.flavorText: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

data.name: Arbok
data.flavorText: The pattern on its belly appears to be a frightening face. Weak foes will flee just at the sight of the pattern.

attacks.name: Gastro Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon has no Abilities until the end of your next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Spoink
data.flavorText: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.

data.name: Grumpig
data.flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes' minds.

attacks.name: Tricky Steps
attacks.text: You may move an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Trevenant
data.flavorText: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.

abilities.name: Forest's Curse
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Tree Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pumpkaboo
data.flavorText: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Gourgeist
data.flavorText: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.

attacks.name: Eerie Voice
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spirit Scream
attacks.text: Put damage counters on both Active Pokémon until the remaining HP of each Pokémon is 10.

data.name: Venipede
data.flavorText: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Whirlipede
data.flavorText: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Scolipede
data.flavorText: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.

attacks.name: Random Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. That Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Phantump
data.flavorText: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

data.name: Diglett
data.flavorText: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

attacks.name: Mine
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your opponent's deck. Then, you may have your opponent shuffle his or her deck.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.

attacks.name: Dig Out
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Fighting Energy, attach it to this Pokémon.

data.name: Dugtrio
data.flavorText: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Rhydon
data.flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Mad Mountain
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Lunatone
data.flavorText: Because it turns active on nights of the full moon, it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Moonblast
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Solrock
data.flavorText: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

attacks.name: Cosmic Spin
attacks.text: If Lunatone is on your Bench, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Rhyperior
data.flavorText: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.

attacks.name: Rock Black
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rock Wrecker
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Conkeldurr
data.flavorText: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.

attacks.name: Wake-Up Slap
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Timburr
data.flavorText: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.

attacks.name: Pummel
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Gurdurr
data.flavorText: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.

attacks.name: Pummel
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Hammer Arm
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Sandile
data.flavorText: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.

data.name: Krokorok
data.flavorText: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Sableye
data.flavorText: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

attacks.name: Filch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Rip Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Krookodile
data.flavorText: Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.

attacks.name: Bother
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Zorua
data.flavorText: It changes so it looks like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Zoroark
data.flavorText: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Night Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Inkay
data.flavorText: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.

abilities.name: Upside-Down Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn, (before your attack), if this Pokémon is Confused, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

data.name: Inkay
data.flavorText: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.

attacks.name: Puncture
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Malamar
data.flavorText: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.

attacks.name: Mental Trash
attacks.text: Your opponent flips 4 coins. For each tails, he or she discards a card from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Distortion Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Yveltal
data.flavorText: When this legendary Pokémon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of all living creatures.

attacks.name: Oblivion Wing
attacks.text: Attach a Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Darkness Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Malamar
data.flavorText: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.

attacks.name: Mental Panic
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Puncture
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Yveltal-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Evil Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Y Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Honedge
data.flavorText: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

data.name: Skarmory-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Joust
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tailspin Piledriver
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: Blades comprise this Pokémon's entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.

attacks.name: Cut Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Metal Wallop
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Metal Wallop attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Doublade
data.flavorText: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.

attacks.name: Dual Blades
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Aegislash
data.flavorText: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

abilities.name: Stance Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch this Pokémon with an Aegislash in your hand. (Any cards attached to this Pokémon, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.)

attacks.name: King's Shield
attacks.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn. This Pokémon can't use King's Shield during your next turn.

data.name: Aegislash
data.flavorText: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

abilities.name: Stance Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch this Pokémon with an Aegislash in your hand. (Any cards attached to this Pokémon, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Buster Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.flavorText: It captivates foes with its huge, round eyes, then lulls them to sleep by singing a soothing melody.

attacks.name: Heartfelt Song
attacks.text: Discard a Darkness Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.flavorText: It captivates foes with its huge, round eyes, then lulls them to sleep by singing a soothing melody.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Mr. Mime
data.flavorText: Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.

attacks.name: Massage
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slap Down
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Wigglytuff
data.flavorText: Their fur feels so good that if two of them snuggle together, they won't want to be separated.

attacks.name: Balloon Barrage
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Wigglytuff
data.flavorText: Their fur feels so good that if two of them snuggle together, they won't want to be separated.

attacks.name: Gather Energy
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hocus Pinkus
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Spritzee
data.flavorText: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Swirlix
data.flavorText: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and as sticky as cotton candy.

data.name: Aromatisse
data.flavorText: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.

abilities.name: Fairy Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Fairy Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

data.name: Dunsparce
data.flavorText: When spotted, this Pokémon escapes backwards by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.

attacks.name: Glare
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Doduo
data.flavorText: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Tauros
data.flavorText: After heightening its will to fight by whipping itself with its three tails, it charges at full speed.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Seething Anger
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each damage counter on this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Slurpuff
data.flavorText: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.

abilities.name: Sweet Veil
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Fairy Energy attached to it can't be affected by any Special Conditions. (Remove any Special Conditions affecting those Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Xerneas
data.flavorText: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

attacks.name: Geomancy
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Fairy Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Rainbow Spear
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Xerneas-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Break Through
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: X Blast
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use X Blast during your next turn.

data.name: Dodrio
data.flavorText: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads—even for a second—will get pecked severely.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Swellow
data.flavorText: If its two tail feathers are standing at attention, it is proof of good health. It soars elegantly in the sky.

abilities.name: Drive Off
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Taillow
data.flavorText: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Skitty
data.flavorText: It can't stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.

attacks.name: Heal Bell
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.name: Delcatty
data.flavorText: It dislikes dirty places. It often searches for a comfortable place in which to groom itself.

attacks.name: Energy Salon
attacks.text: Search your deck for 3 different types of basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Bidoof
data.flavorText: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Bibarel
data.flavorText: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Hypno Headbutt
attacks.text: You may do 30 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Herdier
data.flavorText: This very loyal Pokémon helps Trainers, and it also takes care of other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Stoutland
data.flavorText: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Wild Barking
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Lillipup
data.flavorText: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.

data.name: Diggersby
data.flavorText: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.

attacks.name: Pickup
attacks.text: Put 2 Item cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Bunnelby
data.flavorText: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Cassius
rules: Shuffle 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Fletchling
data.flavorText: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.

attacks.name: Me First
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Furfrou
data.flavorText: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

abilities.name: Fur Coat
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Energy Cutoff
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Fairy Garden
rules: Each Pokémon that has any Fairy Energy attached to it (both yours and your opponent's) has no Retreat Cost.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Evosoda
rules: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Max Revive
rules: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile on top of your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Muscle Band
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hard Charm
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Any damage done to the Pokémon this card is attached to by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor's Letter
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Red Card
rules: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 4 cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Sycamore
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Shadow Circle
rules: Each Pokémon that has any Darkness Energy attached to it (both yours and your opponent's) has no Weakness.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Double Colorless Energy
rules: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

data.name: Team Flare Grunt
rules: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Roller Skates
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, draw 3 cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Shauna
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Super Potion
rules: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Blastoise-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Splash Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Emolga-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Glide
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you attached Energy in this way, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Electron Crush
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Yveltal-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Evil Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Y Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Rainbow Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. While in play, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

data.name: Skarmory-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Joust
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tailspin Piledriver
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Xerneas-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Break Through
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: X Blast
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use X Blast during your next turn.

data.name: Venusaur-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Jungle Hammer
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.
